bibl.title: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to John J. Moran, December 10, 1940

div1.p: Brewer requests that Moran autograph a picture of himself for Hench, to replace the one that has been lost. Moran has been made an honorary alumnus of Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to John J. Moran, December 10, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 10, 1940

div1.p:
Under separate cover I am forwarding you some
pictures of your self and of Dr. Hench which we cannot use
further. Some of the pictures were made from the print
that you sent me when I requested it of you and I suppose
you will find some use for the extra pictures we are send-
ing. In a small way, these pictures will compensate for
your kindness in coming to the College for Founders' Day.

During the rush of those days, we received
from Dr. Hench, a picture which you had personally auto-
graphed for him but the picture was subsequently lost
and now Dr. Hench does not have one of your pictures for
his files. I would appreciate it very much if you would
autograph one of the enclosed photos of yourself that we
have sent you and if you would send it to Dr. Hench. I
know that he would be gratified to receive it. I am very
sorry that this loss happened in our office and that it
has inconvenienced you and Dr. Hench but I believe that
Dr. Hench will be satisfied to receive a second autographed
picture from you.

As Dr. Hutchison pointed out to you in an earlier
letter, we are glad to make you an honorary alumnus of
W. & J. College and hereafter you will receive all of the
literature that ordinarily goes to one of our alumni.

We shall look forward to having you with us
again on the campus in the near future.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, M. D. Brewer
Alumni Secretary Mr. John J. Moran
